intro: Azorella haastii subsp. haastii, commonly known as the Haast's azorella, is a low-growing cushion plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically gray-green and covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. Azorella haastii subsp. haastii is well adapted to harsh, cold environments and is often found in alpine and subantarctic regions.
